name: The Omni New Haven Hotel at Yale

reviews.text: I stayed at the Omni for 5 days whilst attending a conference in New Haven. Arriving by train from New York, the hotel was 10 minutes walk from the station and easy to find. Reception was both friendly and efficient and the room above average for comfort. There was ludicrously large pile of pillows and cushions on the bed but the maid cleared these out of the way and kept them off the bed for the duration of my stay! The view over Yale was spoilt by a large flat roof and unappealing building located nearby. The food provided by the hotel was acceptable, given that they were catering for a large group. The lack of alcohol in the mini-bars was strange and was compounded by the fact that the bar on the 19th floor (views over the rather dull downtown area) closed at midnight or earlier.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay at the Omni

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New Haven itself has little to offer and maintained the theme of early closing, with all bars seeming to shut by 1am on a Thursday night. However, the amusing spectacle of the residents weaving and vomiting their way home so early suggests why this is the case. I would suggest bringing a few good book to stave off boredom in this quiet little city.
reviews.title: Best of a mediocre collection of New Haven hotels

reviews.text: New Haven has been on the upswing over the last decade or so, and the restaurant scene has drastically improved. Its collection of hotels, though, has not. I would describe the Omni as the best of a mediocre lot, and on that basis, I can honestly say I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

reviews.text: Proximity to Yale was important to us, so the Omni was convenient. We could easily go back to our room during the day if we needed to freshen up or forgot something. Our room was decently furnished, the bathroom was fine (although the light was on a timer, which was bust -- hence, we couldn't turn the light off at all, which defeated the purpose of a timer.)
reviews.title: a strange and terrible experience
Nice Place
reviews.text: I found the lobby dark, depressing, and not terribly welcoming. There were two computer terminals off the lobby, but you had to pay to use them. With so many hotels now offering this for free, why can't the Omni follow suit?

I stayed here for 3 nights for business conference with n=100. The hotel cost $98.00/night. When I made my reservation, the hotel staff suggested I join the Omni select club. This gives you free wi-fi internet, choice of pillow, free newspapers of your choice delivered to your room, and free tea or coffee and juice delivered to your room every day. Additionally, you can confirm on line and just get the key when you arrive and go to your room. My room requests were respected. I asked to be on a high floor in a quiet area; there are lots of restaurants and bars downstairs. I was on the 18th floor and it was quiet. The bed, pillows, linens, and towels were very good. There is a refridge in the room full of snacks and drinks, too. The food at the meeting and room service were also of excellent quality. The hotel supplies decent shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and mouthwash. There is a rite-aide pharmacy just around the corner. There is a starbucks, 2 dunkin donuts, and a small grocery store right by the hotel. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great meeting hotel;

reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni New Haven in March 2008 for a weekend function. The hotel was nice, and the staff very friendly. However, we had problem with the temperature of our room. I called housekeeping at 5pm, but no one showed up. 2 hours later, I called the front desk, then someone showed up 15 minutes later. He said that the AC/cooling wasn't working because the rooms were being re-wired and hadn't been tested yet. We spent 20 minutes trying to fix it, I finally left, and he continued. I came back at 9:30pm or 10pm, and the room was still way too hot (75-degrees). I called again, they sent a maintenance guy again. My wife went back to the room around 10:30, maintenance guy said he couldn't fix it. They looked at the room around the corner to see if we could move there, and checked the temperature. It seemed cooler (the thermostat read 69 degrees), so he suggested we move there. At 11pm (we were at a function, and couldn't leave earlier), I took my 2 young boys, went to the front desk, got a key for the new room, and went up stairs.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and friendly service, but management attitude was a killer

reviews.text: We moved rooms (which took about 20 minutes to move our stuff), and then I had the kids get ready for bed. They went to bed at 11:30 (however, this was the Saturday of daylight savings time, so it was really 12:30). But by then, I realized the room felt hot. I checked the thermostat--it read 69 degrees, but the two little travel clocks/thermometers that I travel with both read 73 and 75 degrees (in different places in the room). This room's AC wasn't working either! It was too late for the kids to move to another room, and I had to go back down to the function we were attending. My wife and I came back up at 12:30, and got ready for bed, even though the room was way too hot - 73 degrees.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

likes.liked: — Great ambience, cozy rooms with comfortable bed

reviews.text: From our previous experience, we knew that the maintenance guy would not be able to fix the problem, and if we wanted it resolved, we'd have to move rooms, to another floor, and that was simply not an option at 1:30 - 2am in the morning. We did not call to note it because we were tired, and worn out, and did not want maintenance guy coming to the room at that time of the night.
reviews.title: Loved the Omni

likes.liked: — They treated you like family. It was more than just a place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning, at check out, we tried to talk to the manager, but we were told there was no manager on duty that we could discuss our difficulties with. We subsequently tried to resolve the issue with their management office, which generously offered a complimentary night for a future stay, but would absolutely not budge on any adjustment for the problems we encountered. Again and again they re-iterated how important customer service was, yet they seemed to fail to grasp how frustrating the night had been and what would make the most difference to us as consumers--some type of adjustment on the bill.
reviews.title: A good choice in New Haven

reviews.text: While I would recommend this hotel (though some of the rooms are tight) to others when the price is right, I would caution them to double check the temperature controls when they check in.
reviews.title: A good hotel

description: The Omni New Haven Hotel at Yale combines classic New England style with richly appointed guestrooms and suites in the heart of downtown New Haven, two blocks from Yale University, the New Haven Green and the Shubert Theatre. Newly renovated in 2012, Omni guestrooms are handsomely decorated in traditional style. Beds have soft duvets and feather pillows; bathrooms include robes and makeup mirrors. There is a full-service on-site spa and the hotel fitness center features state-of-the-art cardiovascular and weight training equipment. The top-floor restaurant, John Davenport's, showcases regional specialties complimented by views over the Green, historic Yale Campus and the Long Island Sound. Relax with a beverage in Bar19 next to the restaurant or take a grab and go Starbucks from our cafe Morsels.
